intro: Diaphoranthema capillaris, commonly known as the slender-leaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Diaphoranthema capillaris is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade.
